level.heading: NOTICE OF THE NOTICE OF INFRACTION (ยง 1-2211)

level.text: A Notice of Infraction (“NOI”) shall be in the form prescribed by the Mayor’s appointee or the Gas Station Advisory Board (“GSAB”) Chairman and will be issued for infractions.
A NOI must include the following information
The name and address of the respondent;
A citation to the law or rule that the respondent allegedly violated;
The nature, time and place of the infraction;
The respondent must request a hearing or pay the fine within fifteen days of the date the NOI was served on the respondent;
A penalty equal to the amount of the fine may be imposed on the respondent if the respondent does not pay the fine within fifteen days;
The respondent may request a hearing according to procedures described in the NOI;

The respondent may pay by: (A) cash, which must be paid in person as directed in the NOI; or (B) certified check, postal or bank money order payable to the District of Columbia Treasurer, any of which may be submitted in person or by mail as directed in the NOI.
If the respondent answers “Admit” or “Admit with Explanation,” he or she must certify that each infraction on the NOI has been abated; and
Any other information the Director may require.
If the fine listed on the NOI is inconsistent with the fine listed in the statute, the respondent can be subject only to the lesser fine.
Upon observing an infraction, the investigator may issue an NOI.
A properly completed NOI signed by the issuing agent constitutes prima facie evidence of the statements contained in the Notice.
Each incident of prohibited conduct constitutes a separate infraction subject to penalty.
